CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, page A2, reads: "The Mayor Breaks Ground - With silver pick and shovel, Mayor David L. Lawrence breaks ground with A. N. Brion at the new site of the Greyhound Bus Terminal, due for completion next year. The Mayor wields the shovel, while Mr. Brion, president of the Eastern Division of greyhound uses a pick. Looking on is Pat Navarro of the Navarro Corporation, contracting firm. The handsome new building, with public parking space for over 176 cars will front on 11th St. at Liberty Ave. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eight men, including a camera man far left,  A. N. Brion, president of the Eastern Division of Greyhound Bus, third from left holding pick axe, Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, fourth from left, holding shovel, and Pat Navarro, of the Navarro Corporation contracting firm, fifth from left, gathered in front of a Greyhound bus at the site of the new Greyhound Bus Station on the corner of 11th Street and Liberty Avenue in the Strip District
